item.title: Teenager on sub took Rubik's Cube to break record, mother tells BBC
item.description: In her first interview, Christine Dawood told the BBC she lost hope when the 96-hour mark passed.

item.title: Russia: Instability ratchets up pressure on Vladimir Putin
item.description: Vladimir Putin's mixed messages on the Wagner mutiny have been raising eyebrows and changing perceptions of him.

item.title: The sun goes down on Elton John with a rhapsodic Glastonbury set
item.description: Fans flock to the Pyramid Stage to watch Elton John play the last UK show of his farewell tour.

item.title: Glastonbury: Watch the final day's acts in 93 seconds
item.description: Elton John, Lil Nas X, and Blondie among the stars to have performed on the final day.

item.title: UK's high rate of avoidable deaths linked to NHS woes
item.description: People in UK less likely to survive treatable conditions than in other rich nations, study suggests.

item.title: Prince William risks row to tackle homelessness
item.description: The Prince of Wales launches a five-year project to cut homelessness and change public attitudes.

item.title: Titan sub implosion: US Coast guard launches investigation to recover debris
item.description: The high-level investigation has the power to recommend civil or criminal charges.

item.title: Greek elections: Mitsotakis hails conservative win as mandate for reform
item.description: Kyriakos Mitsotakis says his party is now the most powerful centre-right party in Europe.

item.title: Duchess of York recovering after breast cancer operation
item.description: Sarah Ferguson's doctors have told her that the prognosis is good, her spokesman says.

item.title: UK weather: Joint hottest day of the year as storms lash north
item.description: The joint hottest day of the year so far was recorded on Sunday but the week ahead looks cooler for most.

item.title: Cleethorpes: Girl, 15, dies after being pulled from sea - police
item.description: Two teenagers were airlifted to hospital shortly after 19:30 BST on Saturday, police say.

item.title: 999 calls: Technical glitch fixed for most forces
item.description: BT says a backup service is available and people should call 999 as usual.

item.title: Glastonbury: Man dies after 'medical incident' at festival site
item.description: Avon and Somerset Police say they are not treating the death of a man in his 40s as suspicious.

item.title: Newspaper headlines: 'Fergie cancer battle' and 'Elton bids farewell'
item.description: Monday's papers feature the Duchess of York's breast cancer diagnosis and tributes to Sir Elton John.

item.title: Titanic sub firm: A maverick, rule-breaking founder and a tragic end
item.description: Stockton Rush wanted to be known as an innovator. It didn't seem to matter how he did it.

item.title: Laura Nuttall's sister Gracie: 'It feels like losing a future and a sibling'
item.description: Gracie Nuttall's sister Laura was just 23 when she died from an aggressive form of brain cancer.

item.title: Picking a fair Florida jury for Donald Trump could prove a herculean task
item.description: Biased jurors must be weeded out in a state where Mr Trump receives both strong support and disdain.

item.title: Can we stop being tricked into subscriptions?
item.description: The US and UK are trying to crack down on firms tricking customers into renewing their subscription.

item.title: Scoop: Netflix show depicts colliding worlds of crime and media
item.description: Netflix series Scoop tells the story of a journalist's murder and the wrongful confinement of another.

item.title: Bioluminescent plankton: 'It's the northern lights of the ocean'
item.description: The coastline is seeing a boom in the number of people hunting bioluminescent plankton at night.

item.title: Myanmar Insein: A rare glimpse inside a barbaric prison
item.description: The BBC speaks to prisoners, including an artist whose smuggled sketches record horror inside Myanmar's Insein jail.

item.title: Will Humza Yousaf's broad approach deliver Scottish independence?
item.description: The SNP leader puts an ambiguous stamp on the party's latest Scottish independence planning.

item.title: Ocean Race competitors do their bit to fight plastic pollution
item.description: Teams competing in the gruelling six-month, 60,000km Ocean Race are also doing their bit for climate research.

item.title: Zimbabwe's obsession with Animal Farm as novel gets Shona translation
item.description: George Orwell's satirical novel has such resonance it has been translated into the local Shona language.

item.title: Migrant deaths: 'I saw the boat sink under my feet'
item.description: A survivor of two boat sinkings tells his story in the deadliest year for migrants in the Americas.

item.title: Cheers! Can AI help drinkers buy a better bottle of wine?
item.description: Wine recommendation apps are now using AI to help better match people with a bottle they will like.

item.title: Nottingham attacks: Angling club pays tribute to Ian Coates
item.description: Ian Coates was a keen fisherman who was preparing to spend more time on his hobby in retirement.

item.title: Child dies in Padstow harbour fall
item.description: A five-year-old boy is flown by air ambulance from Padstow to hospital, but dies later.

item.title: Julian Sands: Remains found in California area where British actor disappeared
item.description: The 65-year-old disappeared in mountains north of Los Angeles after hiking in bad weather in January.

item.title: European Athletics Team Championships: Shot putter Jolien Boumkwo runs 100m hurdles
item.description: Following the withdrawal of a team-mate Belgian shot putter Jolien Boumkwo competes in the 100m women's hurdles to gain important points for her nation at the European Athletics Team Championships.

item.title: New documents spark fresh concerns over Ferguson's ferry contract
item.description: Emails reveal behind-the scenes discussions involving ministers and officials at the start of the procurement.

item.title: Birmingham Bentley driver saves day after prom break down
item.description: Thomas, 16, was "devastated" before his family spotted Bentley driver Nav Nasir in traffic.

item.title: Leominster Christmas light switch-on cancelled in June
item.description: A revamp of Leominster town centre is expected to start at the end of the year, the town council says.

item.title: Lee Rigby's mum proud of Bury FC memorial football game
item.description: Football stars Mark Hateley and Peter Reid were among those at a football game in Lee Rigby's honour.

item.title: In pictures: The finalists of Scotland's Home of the Year 2023
item.description: One of these homes will be revealed as winner of Scotland's Home of the Year on Monday.

item.title: Rose Ayling-Ellis calls for free access to sign language lessons
item.description: The actress and Strictly star, who is deaf, believes tuition should be a right, not a privilege.

item.title: Horse 'left to die' is now prize-winning show pony
item.description: Irish police found an exhausted Woody lying across a pavement in County Tipperary last year.

item.title: The Ashes: Australia's greatness prevails but England can still fight on day five
item.description: Australia demonstrated why they are the best team in women's cricket on day four of the Ashes Test, but England have a fighting chance on the final day.

item.title: Kalidou Koulibaly: Chelsea's Senegal defender joins Saudi Pro League's Al-Hilal
item.description: Chelsea's Senegal centre-back Kalidou Koulibaly joins Saudi Pro League side Al-Hilal.

item.title: Carlos Alcaraz: What are Queen's champion's chances of winning Wimbledon?
item.description: After Carlos Alcaraz takes the title at Queen's in only his 11th match on grass, could the young Spaniard go on to win Wimbledon?

item.title: Women's Ashes 2023: Australia stay in control as 15 wickets fall on day four - highlights
item.description: Watch highlights as Australia remain in control over England as 15 wickets fall on day four of the Ashes Test at Trent Bridge.

item.title: MLB London Series: St Louis Cardinals beat Chicago Cubs in game two to level series
item.description: It was honours even at London Stadium this weekend as Major League Baseball made its long-awaited return to the UK.

item.title: Zharnel Hughes: British athlete predicted his 9.83 run to break Linford Christie's 30-year 100m record
item.description: Sprinter Zharnel Hughes says he predicted that he would break Linford Christie's 30-year British men's 100m record after clocking 9.83 seconds in New York.

item.title: England U21 2-0 Israel U21: Anthony Gordon and Emile Smith Rowe put Young Lions into quarters
item.description: England qualify for the quarter-finals of the European Under-21 Championship with a comfortable win over Israel in Georgia.

item.title: Wagner, Prigozhin, Putin and Shoigu: Bitter rivalries that led to a rebellion
item.description: The Wagner mutiny was years in the making, as Russia's system of competing powers finally collapsed.

item.title: Ros Atkins on... five impacts of the Wagner mutiny
item.description: The BBCâ€™s Analysis Editor Ros Atkins looks at what the consequences are of the failed Wagner mutiny.

item.title: What will Putin do next? And other key questions
item.description: What happens to Wagner? What will Putin do next? And how will it affect war in Ukraine? Key questions answered.

item.title: Wagner chief's 24 hours of chaos in Russia
item.description: Wagner's mercenary boss threatened an armed rebellion but pulled back from marching on Moscow.

item.title: Ukraine conflict: Who's in Putin's inner circle and running the war?
item.description: Russia's president relies on a small but deeply loyal group of people when he makes key decisions.

item.title: Russia: Wagner mutiny shows real cracks in Putin authority - US
item.description: Top US diplomat Antony Blinken says an attempted rebellion was a "direct challenge" to President Putin.

item.title: Wagner: Tracking the mercenary group's day of rebellion in Russia
item.description: The US secretary of state calls the actions of the mercenary group a "direct challenge to Putin's authority".

item.title: Cat Stevens soothes an exhausted Glastonbury in the legend slot
item.description: The folk star plays a laid-back, hit-heavy set in the coveted Sunday afternoon "legend slot".

item.title: Spice Girls: Mel C says all of her old group would like to play Glastonbury Festival next year
item.description: The singer fans the flames of rumours her old group could be next in line for the legends slot.

item.title: Glastonbury 2023: Elton John fans reserve front row spaces at crack of dawn
item.description: Fans woke up at the crack of dawn to ensure they could be in the front row when the star plays.

item.title: Loyle Carner: The secrets of the rapper's powerful and personal Glastonbury set
item.description: The South London rapper talks us through his powerful and personal set on The Other Stage.

item.title: Glastonbury review: Guns N' Roses are sporadically brilliant, while Lana Del Rey is cut short
item.description: The hard rock band play a long, but rewarding headline set, while Lana Del Rey is cruelly cut short.

item.title: Glastonbury: Watch Guns N' Roses, Lizzo and Lewis Capaldi perform
item.description: Guns N' Roses, Lizzo and Lewis Capaldi are among the stars to have taken to the stage at Worthy Farm.

item.title: Lewis Capaldi struggles to finish set
item.description: After suffering vocal problems, the Scottish star suggests he might have to take an extended break.

item.title: Rick Astley doesn't let Glastonbury down
item.description: The pop star draws a huge crowd to the Pyramid Stage, for a midday singalong to his greatest hits.

item.title: Arctic Monkeys: A tale of two halves
item.description: The rock band battle through illness to play their headline slot, but the set divides the audience.

item.title: Elton created a 'brand new show' for headline show
item.description: The star, who is playing what could be his final UK show, promises big surprises at Glastonbury.

item.title: Which songs will define this year's festival?
item.description: As the festival gates open, we look at the songs that could give us a "Glastonbury moment" this year.

item.title: Foo Fighters make 'surprise' return
item.description: The US rock band emerged on Friday tea time to play a surprise set on the Pyramid Stage.

item.title: Carly Rae Jepsen: I'll get lost like a child
item.description: The pop star says she hopes to drift off and spend time people watching after her festival debut.

item.title: The areas you don't see at the festival
item.description: Andy Bennett takes us through the things you might miss at Glastonbury.

item.title: My muscle condition won't stop me playing
item.description: Teenager Eli Crossley is playing Glastonbury after a BBC video on his health condition went viral.
